Title: Russian media group Rambler attempting to hold Nginx hostage
Description: Nginx's co-founders were detained on criminal charges and now face civil suits.

Title: Dwitter - javascript demos in 140 characters
Description: Dwitter is a social network for building and sharing visual javascript demos limited to 140 characters. See the impressive creations crammed into so few characters, and play around with your own code!

Description: Learn how to use ASP.NET Core APIs in a class library.

Title: A Quantum Random Number Generator for .NET: The quantum measurement problem and many-worlds approach
Description: In this post I discuss the quantum mechanical measurement problem, the Everettian many-worlds approach to it, and create a quantum RNG client for .NET

Title: Achievement Unlocked: Visual Studio for Mac ASP.NET Core Challenge Completed | Visual Studio Blog
Description: Last month, we kicked-off a challenge for our developer community to build a solution using ASP.NET Core and the new .NET Core features in Visual Studio for Mac. We were delighted to hear from so many of you and we were excited to receive many projects built from scratch using some of the control libraries we highlighted.

Title: .NET Customer Development
Description: Take this survey powered by surveymonkey.com. Create your own surveys for free.

Title: Using Razor Components in Razor Pages or MVC Views
Description: It has been a while since my last blog post. But during this time I have learned many new things and in this blog post I would like to share how I am making use of Razor Components in Razor Pages or MVC Views, without any use of the Server Side Blazor programming model. So in other words use the components for reusability and simplicity over view components, partial views or tag helpers.

Title: Raspberry Pi capacitive-touch musical Christmas tree - Raspberry Pi
Description: With the help of a Bare Conductive Pi Cap, Davy Wybiral hooked up Raspberry Pi to his Christmas tree, creating fantastic musical baubles!

Title: Introduction to Blazor Component Testing
Description: In this post, I'm going to look at how to get started testing Blazor components using Steve Sanderson's testing prototype. To make things more real world, I'm going to add some tests to my Blazored Modal library.

Title: December 12th, 2019
Description: IBM update @IanPartridge and @Chris_Bailey let the group know that following a review by IBM of its open source priorities, it has been decided that they will not be continuing to work on Swift in 2020. As a result, they are both standing down from the workgroup.  @IanPartridge will work to hand over responsibilities for the Swift Docker images and suggested a potential new owner from the community.  The workgroup thanked @IanPartridge, @Chris_Bailey and the rest of the IBM team for their valuab...
